decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting and Thought Scour, while also generating additional mana with Manamorphose, in order to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard for aggressive plays. This is complemented by a flurry of cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Gut Shot to control the board, with Crackling Drake and Thing in the Ice providing additional threats. The aim is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of burst damage and resilient creatures, making it a fast-paced and deadly Aggro deck.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using efficient burn spells and fast creatures. By maintaining consistent pressure and preventing the opponent from stabilizing, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent has a chance to set up their own strategy. With a combination of direct damage spells, creatures with haste, and spell disruption, this aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory in a fast-paced Modern format.

This deck focuses on quickly reducing your own life total in order to make Death's Shadow a huge threat on the battlefield. Using a combination of self-damage cards like Street Wraith and aggressive creatures like Gurmag Angler, along with disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Stubborn Denial, the goal is to trigger Death's Shadow's ability to become a massive threat while controlling the opponent's board. The deck aims to be fast and aggressive, putting pressure on the opponent from the very beginning and finishing with a powerful, game-winning attack.

The main concept of this UR Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan while efficiently drawing cards and removing threats. The deck utilizes a combination of counterspells, removal, and bounce spells to keep the opponent off balance, while also using card advantage engines like Snapcaster Mage and Serum Visions. Thing in the Ice serves as a win condition that can quickly close out the game once the opponent's board has been cleared. The mana base is focused on producing the necessary colors and maximizing fetchland synergy.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays and tempo control by using efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Snapcaster Mage, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Wizard's Lightning. It also includes disruptive elements like Vendilion Clique and Nimble Obstructionist to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to quickly apply pressure on the opponent while using counter spells like Mana Leak and Remand to protect its own threats. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive strategy while providing consistency in casting spells.

This deck is focused on quickly getting Arclight Phoenix onto the battlefield by casting multiple spells in a turn. It utilizes cantrips like Opt and Serum Visions to dig for the necessary cards while also fueling the graveyard for Phoenix. Cards like Lightning Bolt and Gut Shot provide removal and reach, while Crackling Drake and Thing in the Ice serve as backup threats. The deck aims to be aggressive and explosive, with the potential to close out games quickly with a flurry of spells and flying Phoenixes.

This deck focuses on utilizing Hardened Scales to buff up +1/+1 counters on creatures and artifacts, creating a powerful aggro strategy that can overwhelm opponents quickly. It combines efficient creatures like Arcbound Ravager and Hangarback Walker with cards like Throne of Geth and Animation Module to generate more value and pressure. The deck also includes support cards like Welding Jar and Mox Opal to protect important pieces and ramp up mana for explosive turns. Overall, the key concept is to create a strong board presence and outpace opponents with a relentless aggro strategy.

The key concept of this UR Storm deck is to quickly generate mana and cards through spells like Pyretic Ritual, Manamorphose, and Baral, Chief of Compliance, in order to chain together a large number of spells to either cast a Grapeshot for lethal damage or set up a massive Empty the Warrens to flood the board with goblin tokens. The deck also utilizes cards like Gifts Ungiven to tutor for key combo pieces and Past in Flames to recur key spells from the graveyard for additional explosive turns.

The deck revolves around using Krark-Clan Ironworks and various artifacts like Scrap Trawler to generate mana and card advantage, allowing players to loop through their deck and eventually win the game through a combo finish. By utilizing cards like Sai, Master Thopterist and Ichor Wellspring, the deck can generate a large number of tokens and draw cards efficiently. With the right timing and sequencing of plays, the deck can quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm opponents with its ability to generate value and resources.

The main concept of this deck is to use aggressive creatures like Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler to quickly deplete the opponent's life total. Utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, and Stubborn Denial to control the board and protect your threats, while also using cards like Mishra's Bauble and Thought Scour to quickly fill up your graveyard for delve creatures. The deck aims to win the game quickly through efficient removal and powerful creatures, while also having disruption and protection against opposing spells.

The main concept of this deck revolves around using cards like Krark-Clan Ironworks, Scrap Trawler, and Myr Retriever to create infinite combos that generate lots of mana and card advantage. By sacrificing artifacts like Terrarion and Ichor Wellspring, you can loop through your graveyard to continually bring back key pieces and generate an overwhelming advantage. Engineered Explosives and Sai, Master Thopterist provide additional utility and ways to control the board while you set up your combos. The key strategy is to efficiently assemble your combo pieces while managing your resources effectively.

This deck is focused on quickly pressuring the opponent with aggressive creatures while disrupting their game plan. It includes a mixture of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, removal spells such as Fatal Push and Assassin's Trophy, and powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Tireless Tracker. The deck also features strong planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope to provide additional value and board control. The deck aims to control the board and overwhelm the opponent with its efficient threats.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana through rituals and cantrips to set up a powerful Storm combo. By using cards like Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer to reduce spell costs, the deck can chain together multiple spells in a single turn to eventually cast Grapeshot for lethal damage. Gifts Ungiven is used to find key combo pieces like Past in Flames, allowing the player to recast spells from the graveyard. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a high storm count and finish them off with a big Grapeshot.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize the synergy between cards like Krark-Clan Ironworks, Scrap Trawler, and Myr Retriever to generate a lot of mana and card advantage by sacrificing artifacts like Terrarion and Ichor Wellspring. This combo allows the player to dig through the deck quickly using cards like Ancient Stirrings to find key pieces like Aetherflux Reservoir and Engineered Explosives to control the board. The deck aims to create a powerful engine that can win the game quickly through a big storm turn or by draining the opponent's life total with Aetherflux Reservoir.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build up a strong board presence through the use of cards that benefit from +1/+1 counters, such as Hardened Scales, Steel Overseer, and Hangarback Walker. By using cards like Animation Module and Throne of Geth, the deck can generate an abundance of +1/+1 counters to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes ways to protect its key pieces with cards like Welding Jar and ways to generate additional mana with Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum. Overall, the strategy of this deck is to outpace and overpower the opponent with a swarm of growing threats.

The main concept of this Aggro - Arclight Phoenix deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with spells using cards like Thought Scour, Opt, and Manamorphose to trigger the Arclight Phoenix ability and bring it back from the graveyard. The deck also includes cards like Faithless Looting and Serum Visions to help dig for key pieces and maintain card advantage. Monastery Swiftspear and Thing in the Ice provide additional threats and Crackling Drake offers a powerful flying finisher. Lightning Bolt and Gut Shot provide removal and direct damage to control the board.
